summary: According to the UN’s World Health Organization, tobacco use is one of the leading causes of preventable deaths. It kills over 8 million each year—almost three times the total deaths from tuberculosis, HIV/AIDS, and malaria. We reviewed U.S. global tobacco control efforts for 2015-2018. We found U.S. funding mainly supported research and surveillance—for example, tracking tobacco use. The Department of Health and Human Services provided...
title: Global Tobacco Control: U.S. Efforts Have Primarily Focused on Research and Surveillance
